definition: to drape over one's shoulders/to open/to unroll/to split open/to spread out
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
leather/skin/fur/CL:張|张[zhang1]/pico- (one trillionth)/naughty
surname Pi
to reveal/to publish/to make public/to announce
cape/shawl/(of long hair) to trail over one's shoulders
to sweep everything before one/to be invincible (idiom)
cloak/cape
to put on a suit of armor/to put on dress/to wear
lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
with dishevelled hair (idiom)/with one's hair down
to travel or work through night and day/to toil away for long hours
to drape sb in red silk as a sign of honor
to wear mourning clothes/to be in mourning/also written 披麻帶孝|披麻带孝
to don armor
to be swept by the wind/to be blown about by the wind/to be routed (in battle etc)
lit. to open one's liver and drip gall (idiom); wholehearted loyalty
to peruse/to browse
to wear mourning clothes/to be in mourning/also written 披麻戴孝

sentences.english: Although their juices had run dry, the leaves still exuded a pleasant aroma.
sentences.chinese: 只管已干涸，落叶仍披发出好闻的喷香味。

sentences.english: And you will be clothed with my cloak cordiality, towards bloomy spring warm spring.
sentences.chinese: 而你将披戴着我的斗篷的情意，走向春暖花开的暖春。

sentences.english: I was obviously a german in italian uniform .
sentences.chinese: 我显然是个披着意军制服的德国人。

sentences.english: The sun has his simple rode of light. The clouds are decked with gorgeousness.
sentences.chinese: 太阳只穿一件朴素的光衣，白云却披了灿烂的裙裾。

sentences.english: It fell like black satin curtains on either side of his broad face.
sentences.chinese: 他的头发就如同黑色丝缎窗帘披在他的宽脸盘上。

sentences.english: Faith clothes me with the power of Jehovah.
sentences.chinese: 信心使我披戴耶和华的能力。

sentences.english: I better get the sack and put it over my shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 我还是把布袋拿来披在肩膀上吧。

sentences.english: Artemis instantly cast a cloud over her body, but the pigheaded Alpheus was not to be tricked.
sentences.chinese: 阿耳特弥斯迅速将一层云雾披在仙女的身上。

sentences.english: She pushed heavy yellow hair away from her face.
sentences.chinese: 她撩开披在脸上的浓黄头发。

sentences.english: I am wearing a dress made of rainbow, dipping myself into the blue brook of time.
sentences.chinese: 我披一件彩霞，跳进了时间深处流淌蓝色溪流中。

sentences.english: The trend nowadays is more towards natural curls that fall gently down your shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 今天的流行趋是更多自然的弯曲发头披在肩上。

sentences.english: It has slender leaves and long internode.
sentences.chinese: 叶片较窄，平展而细长，略下披，节间较长。

sentences.english: He was given a sash emblazoned with “Mr. Bear Arabia, ” and draped it over his bare chest as other men offered congratulations.
sentences.chinese: 他把肩带披在赤裸的前胸，其它男人纷纷上前祝贺。

sentences.english: He's really a wolf in sheep's clothing.
sentences.chinese: 他是一只披了羔羊皮的狼。

sentences.english: She wore a silver-grey jacket and a bordeaux red cloak, so was I.
sentences.chinese: 她穿一身银灰色夹克服，披一件枣红色斗篷。

sentences.english: Both upper side and subiculum have brown whiskers and look good.
sentences.chinese: 上披和下托边边都有棕须，十分耐看。

overcoat/cloak/cape/CL:件[jian4]
overcoat
robe
shawl
Chinese-style long robe worn as outermost garment/burqa
to attack/to inherit/classifier for suits (esp. of funeral robes)
cape/shawl/(of long hair) to trail over one's shoulders
outer clothing/semblance/appearance
unlined garment
Chinese-style gown
clothes
evil spirit/goblin/witchcraft/variant of 妖[yao1]/common erroneous variant of 祆[Xian1] Ormazda
garment/jacket with open slits in place of sleeves
overalls/CL:件[jian4]
to bind/to wrap/a bundle/a parcel
